Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply,,My husband will be 72 in April ..not sure about his pathology report..I am going to see about getting his records..I think his PSA before was around 13 ..not sure..will find out that to .. Seems that the cancer may have broke threw the prostate..but seems they would have given radiation at that time..he didn't have it . He is seeing a urologist . A few yrs before he had prostate cancer he had throat cancer..went threw radiaton and cemo..
Posts.Title: Post Prostate cancer

Posts.Content: My husband had robot surgery july 2007,his numbers were T2A, gleason score 6(3+3) estamated 50 50 chance.. His psa was normal for the first 3 yrs. was .05 last yr .10 and this week .25 what does this mean?..and his doctor is having it tested again in 3 mo. I know he is worried about it ,would like some info..thanks .Nancy
Posts.Title: Post Prostate cancer

Posts.Content: Thank for your input.We got his report the other day,,here it is .His Gleason grade 8 pT3aNxMx prostate cancer (Walsh:extracapsular extension surgical margin negative.)Postoperatively,he has done well and been followed by Dr.,,,,,.He currently uses )0 pads....etc. Assessment:1.Prostate cancer: Likely recurrence.Will repeat PSA in 3 mo. 2.Urinary incontinence: Perfect urinary control etc. Please let me know what you think..sounds like they want to wait to see what the next PSA will be., Plan 1. Rerturn to clinic in 3 mo.with preclinical PSA ,exam ,continence,and potency checks.
